00048 #define WORDS_PER_DATA_PHASE (1)

00087 /***************************************************************************/
00101 void MSC_Init(void)
00102 {
00103 #if defined( _MSC_TIMEBASE_MASK )
00104   uint32_t freq, cycles;
00105 #endif
00106   /* Unlock the MSC */
00107   MSC->LOCK = MSC_UNLOCK_CODE;
00108   /* Disable writing to the flash */
00109   MSC->WRITECTRL &= ~MSC_WRITECTRL_WREN;
00110 
00111   /* Call SystemCoreClockGet in order to set the global variable SystemCoreClock
00112      which is used in MSC_LoadWriteData to make sure the frequency is
00113      sufficiently high. If the clock frequency is changed then software is
00114      responsible for calling MSC_Init or SystemCoreClockGet in order to set the
00115      SystemCoreClock variable to the correct value. */
00116   SystemCoreClockGet();
00117 
00118 #if defined( _MSC_TIMEBASE_MASK )
00119   /* Configure MSC->TIMEBASE according to selected frequency */
00120   freq = CMU_ClockFreqGet(cmuClock_AUX);
00121 
00122   if (freq > 7000000)
00123   {
00124     /* Calculate number of clock cycles for 1us as base period */
00125     freq   = (freq * 11) / 10;
00126     cycles = (freq / 1000000) + 1;
00127 
00128     /* Configure clock cycles for flash timing */
00129     MSC->TIMEBASE = (MSC->TIMEBASE & ~(_MSC_TIMEBASE_BASE_MASK
00130                                        | _MSC_TIMEBASE_PERIOD_MASK))
00131                     | MSC_TIMEBASE_PERIOD_1US
00132                     | (cycles << _MSC_TIMEBASE_BASE_SHIFT);
00133   }
00134   else
00135   {
00136     /* Calculate number of clock cycles for 5us as base period */
00137     freq   = (freq * 5 * 11) / 10;
00138     cycles = (freq / 1000000) + 1;
00139 
00140     /* Configure clock cycles for flash timing */
00141     MSC->TIMEBASE = (MSC->TIMEBASE & ~(_MSC_TIMEBASE_BASE_MASK
00142                                        | _MSC_TIMEBASE_PERIOD_MASK))
00143                     | MSC_TIMEBASE_PERIOD_5US
00144                     | (cycles << _MSC_TIMEBASE_BASE_SHIFT);
00145   }
00146 #endif
00147 }
00148 
00149 /***************************************************************************/
00153 void MSC_Deinit(void)
00154 {
00155   /* Disable writing to the flash */
00156   MSC->WRITECTRL &= ~MSC_WRITECTRL_WREN;
00157   /* Lock the MSC */
00158   MSC->LOCK = 0;
00159 }

00163 /***************************************************************************/
00170 void MSC_ExecConfigSet(MSC_ExecConfig_TypeDef *execConfig)
00171 {
00172   uint32_t mscReadCtrl;
00173 
00174   mscReadCtrl = MSC->READCTRL & ~(0
00175 #if defined( MSC_READCTRL_SCBTP )
00176                                   | MSC_READCTRL_SCBTP
00177 #endif
00178 #if defined( MSC_READCTRL_USEHPROT )
00179                                   | MSC_READCTRL_USEHPROT
00180 #endif
00181 #if defined( MSC_READCTRL_PREFETCH )
00182                                   | MSC_READCTRL_PREFETCH
00183 #endif
00184 #if defined( MSC_READCTRL_ICCDIS )
00185                                   | MSC_READCTRL_ICCDIS
00186 #endif
00187 #if defined( MSC_READCTRL_AIDIS )
00188                                   | MSC_READCTRL_AIDIS
00189 #endif
00190 #if defined( MSC_READCTRL_IFCDIS )
00191                                   | MSC_READCTRL_IFCDIS
00192 #endif
00193                                   );
00194   mscReadCtrl |= (0
00195 #if defined( MSC_READCTRL_SCBTP )
00196                  | (execConfig->scbtEn ? MSC_READCTRL_SCBTP : 0)
00197 #endif
00198 #if defined( MSC_READCTRL_USEHPROT )
00199                  | (execConfig->useHprot ? MSC_READCTRL_USEHPROT : 0)
00200 #endif
00201 #if defined( MSC_READCTRL_PREFETCH )
00202                  | (execConfig->prefetchEn ? MSC_READCTRL_PREFETCH : 0)
00203 #endif
00204 #if defined( MSC_READCTRL_ICCDIS )
00205                  | (execConfig->iccDis ? MSC_READCTRL_ICCDIS : 0)
00206 #endif
00207 #if defined( MSC_READCTRL_AIDIS )
00208                  | (execConfig->aiDis ? MSC_READCTRL_AIDIS : 0)
00209 #endif
00210 #if defined( MSC_READCTRL_IFCDIS )
00211                  | (execConfig->ifcDis ? MSC_READCTRL_IFCDIS : 0)
00212 #endif
00213                  );
00214   MSC->READCTRL = mscReadCtrl;
00215 }

00243 /* "Possible rom access from within a __ramfunc function"               */

00249 __STATIC_INLINE MSC_Status_TypeDef MSC_LoadVerifyAddress(uint32_t* address)
00250 {
00251   uint32_t status;
00252   uint32_t timeOut;
00253 
00254   /* Wait for the MSC to become ready. */
00255   timeOut = MSC_PROGRAM_TIMEOUT;
00256   while ((MSC->STATUS & MSC_STATUS_BUSY) && (timeOut != 0))
00257   {
00258     timeOut--;
00259   }
00260 
00261   /* Check for timeout */
00262   if (timeOut == 0)
00263   {
00264     return mscReturnTimeOut;
00265   }
00266   /* Load address */
00267   MSC->ADDRB    = (uint32_t)address;
00268   MSC->WRITECMD = MSC_WRITECMD_LADDRIM;
00269 
00270   status = MSC->STATUS;
00271   if (status & (MSC_STATUS_INVADDR | MSC_STATUS_LOCKED))
00272   {
00273     /* Check for invalid address */
00274     if (status & MSC_STATUS_INVADDR)
00275       return mscReturnInvalidAddr;
00276     /* Check for write protected page */
00277     if (status & MSC_STATUS_LOCKED)
00278       return mscReturnLocked;
00279   }
00280   return mscReturnOk;
00281 }
00282 #if defined(__ICCARM__)
00283 #pragma diag_default=Ta022
00284 #pragma diag_default=Ta023
00285 #elif defined(__CC_ARM)  /* MDK-ARM compiler */
00286 #pragma arm section code
00287 #endif /* __CC_ARM */

00290 /***************************************************************************/
00310 #if !defined(EM_MSC_RUN_FROM_FLASH)
00311 #if defined(__CC_ARM)  /* MDK-ARM compiler */
00312 #pragma arm section code="ram_code"
00313 #elif defined(__ICCARM__)
00314 /* Suppress warnings originating from use of EFM_ASSERT():              */
00315 /* "Call to a non __ramfunc function from within a __ramfunc function"  */
00316 /* "Possible rom access from within a __ramfunc function"               */
00317 #pragma diag_suppress=Ta022
00318 #pragma diag_suppress=Ta023
00319 __ramfunc
00320 #endif
00321 #endif /* !EM_MSC_RUN_FROM_FLASH */
00322 __STATIC_INLINE MSC_Status_TypeDef
00323   MSC_LoadWriteData(uint32_t* data,
00324                     uint32_t numWords,
00325                     MSC_WriteStrategy_Typedef writeStrategy)
00326 {
00327   uint32_t timeOut;
00328   uint32_t wordIndex;
00329   uint32_t wordsPerDataPhase;
00330   MSC_Status_TypeDef retval = mscReturnOk;
00331 
00332 #if defined(_MSC_WRITECTRL_LPWRITE_MASK) && defined(_MSC_WRITECTRL_WDOUBLE_MASK)
00333   /* If LPWRITE (Low Power Write) is NOT enabled, set WDOUBLE (Write Double word) */
00334   if (!(MSC->WRITECTRL & MSC_WRITECTRL_LPWRITE))
00335   {
00336     /* If the number of words to be written are odd, we need to align by writing
00337        a single word first, before setting the WDOUBLE bit. */
00338     if (numWords & 0x1)
00339     {
00340       /* Wait for the MSC to become ready for the next word. */
00341       timeOut = MSC_PROGRAM_TIMEOUT;
00342       while ((!(MSC->STATUS & MSC_STATUS_WDATAREADY)) && (timeOut != 0))
00343       {
00344         timeOut--;
00345       }
00346       /* Check for timeout */
00347       if (timeOut == 0)
00348       {
00349         return mscReturnTimeOut;
00350       }
00351       /* Clear double word option, in order to write the initial single word. */
00352       MSC->WRITECTRL &= ~MSC_WRITECTRL_WDOUBLE;
00353       /* Write first data word. */
00354       MSC->WDATA = *data++;
00355       MSC->WRITECMD = MSC_WRITECMD_WRITEONCE;
00356 
00357       /* Wait for the operation to finish. It may be required to change the WDOUBLE
00358          config after the initial write. It should not be changed while BUSY. */
00359       timeOut = MSC_PROGRAM_TIMEOUT;
00360       while((MSC->STATUS & MSC_STATUS_BUSY) && (timeOut != 0))
00361       {
00362         timeOut--;
00363       }
00364       /* Check for timeout */
00365       if (timeOut == 0)
00366       {
00367         return mscReturnTimeOut;
00368       }
00369       /* Subtract this initial odd word for the write loop below */
00370       numWords -= 1;
00371       retval = mscReturnOk;
00372     }
00373     /* Now we can set the double word option in order to write two words per
00374        data phase. */
00375     MSC->WRITECTRL |= MSC_WRITECTRL_WDOUBLE;
00376     wordsPerDataPhase = 2;
00377   }
00378   else
00379 #endif /* defined( _MSC_WRITECTRL_LPWRITE_MASK ) && defined( _MSC_WRITECTRL_WDOUBLE_MASK ) */
00380   {
00381     wordsPerDataPhase = 1;
00382   }
00383 
00384   /* Write the rest as double word write if wordsPerDataPhase == 2 */
00385   if (numWords > 0)
00386   {
00387     /**** Write strategy: mscWriteIntSafe ****/
00388     if (writeStrategy == mscWriteIntSafe)
00389     {
00390       /* Requires a system core clock at 1MHz or higher */
00391       EFM_ASSERT(SystemCoreClockGet() >= 1000000);
00392       wordIndex = 0;
00393       while(wordIndex < numWords)
00394       {
00395         MSC->WDATA = *data++;
00396         wordIndex++;
00397         if (wordsPerDataPhase == 2)
00398         {
00399           while (!(MSC->STATUS & MSC_STATUS_WDATAREADY));
00400           MSC->WDATA = *data++;
00401           wordIndex++;
00402         }
00403         MSC->WRITECMD = MSC_WRITECMD_WRITEONCE;
00404 
00405         /* Wait for the transaction to finish. */
00406         timeOut = MSC_PROGRAM_TIMEOUT;
00407         while ((MSC->STATUS & MSC_STATUS_BUSY) && (timeOut != 0))
00408         {
00409           timeOut--;
00410         }
00411         /* Check for timeout */
00412         if (timeOut == 0)
00413         {
00414           retval = mscReturnTimeOut;
00415           break;
00416         }
00417 #if defined( _EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY )
00418         MSC->ADDRB += 4;
00419         MSC->WRITECMD = MSC_WRITECMD_LADDRIM;
00420 #endif
00421       }
00422     }
00423 
00424     /**** Write strategy: mscWriteFast ****/
00425     else
00426     {
00427 #if defined( _EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY )
00428       /* Gecko does not have auto-increment of ADDR. */
00429       EFM_ASSERT(0);
00430 #else
00431       /* Requires a system core clock at 14MHz or higher */
00432       EFM_ASSERT(SystemCoreClockGet() >= 14000000);
00433 
00434       wordIndex = 0;
00435       INT_Disable();
00436       while(wordIndex < numWords)
00437       {
00438         /* Wait for the MSC to be ready for the next word. */
00439         while (!(MSC->STATUS & MSC_STATUS_WDATAREADY))
00440         {
00441           /* If the write to MSC->WDATA below missed the 30us timeout and the
00442              following MSC_WRITECMD_WRITETRIG command arrived while
00443              MSC_STATUS_BUSY is 1, then the MSC_WRITECMD_WRITETRIG could be ignored by
00444              the MSC. In this case, MSC_STATUS_WORDTIMEOUT is set to 1
00445              and MSC_STATUS_BUSY is 0. A new trigger is therefore needed here to
00446              complete write of data in MSC->WDATA.
00447              If WDATAREADY became high since entry into this loop, exit and continue
00448              to the next WDATA write.
00449           */
00450           if ((MSC->STATUS & (MSC_STATUS_WORDTIMEOUT
00451                               | MSC_STATUS_BUSY
00452                               | MSC_STATUS_WDATAREADY))
00453               == MSC_STATUS_WORDTIMEOUT)
00454           {
00455             MSC->WRITECMD = MSC_WRITECMD_WRITETRIG;
00456           }
00457         }
00458         MSC->WDATA = *data;
00459         if ((wordsPerDataPhase == 1)
00460             || ((wordsPerDataPhase == 2) && (wordIndex & 0x1)))
00461         {
00462           MSC->WRITECMD = MSC_WRITECMD_WRITETRIG;
00463         }
00464         data++;
00465         wordIndex++;
00466       }
00467       INT_Enable();
00468 
00469       /* Wait for the transaction to finish. */
00470       timeOut = MSC_PROGRAM_TIMEOUT;
00471       while ((MSC->STATUS & MSC_STATUS_BUSY) && (timeOut != 0))
00472       {
00473         timeOut--;
00474       }
00475       /* Check for timeout */
00476       if (timeOut == 0)
00477       {
00478         retval = mscReturnTimeOut;
00479       }
00480 #endif
00481     } /* writeStrategy */
00482   }
00483 
00484 #if defined( _MSC_WRITECTRL_WDOUBLE_MASK )
00485   /* Clear double word option, which should not be left on when returning. */
00486   MSC->WRITECTRL &= ~MSC_WRITECTRL_WDOUBLE;
00487 #endif
00488 
00489   return retval;
00490 }
00491 #if defined(__ICCARM__)
00492 #pragma diag_default=Ta022
00493 #pragma diag_default=Ta023
00494 #elif defined(__CC_ARM)  /* MDK-ARM compiler */
00495 #pragma arm section code
00496 #endif /* __CC_ARM */

00499 /***************************************************************************/
00513 #if !defined(EM_MSC_RUN_FROM_FLASH)
00514 #if defined(__CC_ARM)  /* MDK-ARM compiler */
00515 #pragma arm section code="ram_code"
00516 #elif defined(__ICCARM__)
00517 /* Suppress warnings originating from use of EFM_ASSERT():              */
00518 /* "Call to a non __ramfunc function from within a __ramfunc function"  */
00519 /* "Possible rom access from within a __ramfunc function"               */
00520 #pragma diag_suppress=Ta022
00521 #pragma diag_suppress=Ta023
00522 #endif
00523 #endif /* !EM_MSC_RUN_FROM_FLASH */
00524 static MSC_Status_TypeDef MSC_WriteWordI(uint32_t *address,
00525                                          void const *data,
00526                                          uint32_t numBytes,
00527                                          MSC_WriteStrategy_Typedef writeStrategy)
00528 {
00529   uint32_t wordCount;
00530   uint32_t numWords;
00531   uint32_t pageWords;
00532   uint32_t* pData;
00533   MSC_Status_TypeDef retval = mscReturnOk;
00534 
00535   /* Check alignment (Must be aligned to words) */
00536   EFM_ASSERT(((uint32_t) address & 0x3) == 0);
00537 
00538   /* Check number of bytes. Must be divisable by four */
00539   EFM_ASSERT((numBytes & 0x3) == 0);
00540 
00541   /* Enable writing to the MSC */
00542   MSC->WRITECTRL |= MSC_WRITECTRL_WREN;
00543 
00544   /* Convert bytes to words */
00545   numWords = numBytes >> 2;
00546   EFM_ASSERT(numWords > 0);
00547 
00548   /* The following loop splits the data into chunks corresponding to flash pages.
00549      The address is loaded only once per page, because the hardware automatically
00550      increments the address internally for each data load inside a page. */
00551   for (wordCount = 0, pData = (uint32_t *)data; wordCount < numWords; )
00552   {
00553     /* First we load address. The address is auto-incremented within a page.
00554        Therefore the address phase is only needed once for each page. */
00555     retval = MSC_LoadVerifyAddress(address + wordCount);
00556     if (mscReturnOk != retval)
00557     {
00558       return retval;
00559     }
00560     /* Compute the number of words to write to the current page. */
00561     pageWords =
00562       (FLASH_PAGE_SIZE -
00563        (((uint32_t) (address + wordCount)) & (FLASH_PAGE_SIZE - 1)))
00564       / sizeof(uint32_t);
00565     if (pageWords > numWords - wordCount)
00566     {
00567       pageWords = numWords - wordCount;
00568     }
00569     /* Now write the data in the current page. */
00570     retval = MSC_LoadWriteData(pData, pageWords, writeStrategy);
00571     if (mscReturnOk != retval)
00572     {
00573       break;
00574     }
00575     wordCount += pageWords;
00576     pData += pageWords;
00577   }
00578 
00579   /* Disable writing to the MSC */
00580   MSC->WRITECTRL &= ~MSC_WRITECTRL_WREN;
00581 
00582 #if defined( _MSC_WRITECTRL_WDOUBLE_MASK )
00583 #if ( WORDS_PER_DATA_PHASE == 2 )
00584   /* Turn off double word write cycle support. */
00585   MSC->WRITECTRL &= ~MSC_WRITECTRL_WDOUBLE;
00586 #endif
00587 #endif
00588 
00589   return retval;
00590 }
00591 #if defined(__ICCARM__)
00592 #pragma diag_default=Ta022
00593 #pragma diag_default=Ta023
00594 #elif defined(__CC_ARM)  /* MDK-ARM compiler */
00595 #pragma arm section code
00596 #endif /* __CC_ARM */
00597 
00601 /***************************************************************************/
00626 #if !defined(EM_MSC_RUN_FROM_FLASH)
00627 #if defined(__CC_ARM)  /* MDK-ARM compiler */
00628 #pragma arm section code="ram_code"
00629 #elif defined(__ICCARM__)
00630 /* Suppress warnings originating from use of EFM_ASSERT():              */
00631 /* "Call to a non __ramfunc function from within a __ramfunc function"  */
00632 /* "Possible rom access from within a __ramfunc function"               */
00633 #pragma diag_suppress=Ta022
00634 #pragma diag_suppress=Ta023
00635 #endif
00636 #endif /* !EM_MSC_RUN_FROM_FLASH */
00637 MSC_Status_TypeDef MSC_ErasePage(uint32_t *startAddress)
00638 {
00639   uint32_t timeOut = MSC_PROGRAM_TIMEOUT;
00640 
00641   /* Address must be aligned to pages */
00642   EFM_ASSERT((((uint32_t) startAddress) & (FLASH_PAGE_SIZE - 1)) == 0);
00643 
00644   /* Enable writing to the MSC */
00645   MSC->WRITECTRL |= MSC_WRITECTRL_WREN;
00646 
00647   /* Load address */
00648   MSC->ADDRB    = (uint32_t)startAddress;
00649   MSC->WRITECMD = MSC_WRITECMD_LADDRIM;
00650 
00651   /* Check for invalid address */
00652   if (MSC->STATUS & MSC_STATUS_INVADDR)
00653   {
00654     /* Disable writing to the MSC */
00655     MSC->WRITECTRL &= ~MSC_WRITECTRL_WREN;
00656     return mscReturnInvalidAddr;
00657   }
00658   /* Check for write protected page */
00659   if (MSC->STATUS & MSC_STATUS_LOCKED)
00660   {
00661     /* Disable writing to the MSC */
00662     MSC->WRITECTRL &= ~MSC_WRITECTRL_WREN;
00663     return mscReturnLocked;
00664   }
00665   /* Send erase page command */
00666   MSC->WRITECMD = MSC_WRITECMD_ERASEPAGE;
00667 
00668   /* Wait for the erase to complete */
00669   while ((MSC->STATUS & MSC_STATUS_BUSY) && (timeOut != 0))
00670   {
00671     timeOut--;
00672   }
00673   if (timeOut == 0)
00674   {
00675     /* Disable writing to the MSC */
00676     MSC->WRITECTRL &= ~MSC_WRITECTRL_WREN;
00677     return mscReturnTimeOut;
00678   }
00679   /* Disable writing to the MSC */
00680   MSC->WRITECTRL &= ~MSC_WRITECTRL_WREN;
00681   return mscReturnOk;
00682 }
00683 #if defined(__ICCARM__)
00684 #pragma diag_default=Ta022
00685 #pragma diag_default=Ta023
00686 #elif defined(__CC_ARM)  /* MDK-ARM compiler */
00687 #pragma arm section code
00688 #endif /* __CC_ARM */
00689

00691 /***************************************************************************/
00727 #if !defined(EM_MSC_RUN_FROM_FLASH)
00728 #if defined(__CC_ARM)  /* MDK-ARM compiler */
00729 #pragma arm section code="ram_code"
00730 #elif defined(__ICCARM__)
00731 /* Suppress warnings originating from use of EFM_ASSERT():              */
00732 /* "Call to a non __ramfunc function from within a __ramfunc function"  */
00733 /* "Possible rom access from within a __ramfunc function"               */
00734 #pragma diag_suppress=Ta022
00735 #pragma diag_suppress=Ta023
00736 #endif
00737 #endif /* !EM_MSC_RUN_FROM_FLASH */
00738 MSC_Status_TypeDef MSC_WriteWord(uint32_t *address,
00739                                   void const *data,
00740                                   uint32_t numBytes)
00741 {
00742   return MSC_WriteWordI(address, data, numBytes, mscWriteIntSafe);
00743 }
00744 #if defined(__ICCARM__)
00745 #pragma diag_default=Ta022
00746 #pragma diag_default=Ta023
00747 #elif defined(__CC_ARM)  /* MDK-ARM compiler */
00748 #pragma arm section code

00752 #if !defined( _EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY )
00753 /***************************************************************************/
00786 #if !defined(EM_MSC_RUN_FROM_FLASH)
00787 #if defined(__CC_ARM)  /* MDK-ARM compiler */
00788 #pragma arm section code="ram_code"
00789 #elif defined(__ICCARM__)
00790 /* Suppress warnings originating from use of EFM_ASSERT():              */
00791 /* "Call to a non __ramfunc function from within a __ramfunc function"  */
00792 /* "Possible rom access from within a __ramfunc function"               */
00793 #pragma diag_suppress=Ta022

00795 #endif
00796 #endif /* !EM_MSC_RUN_FROM_FLASH */
00797 MSC_Status_TypeDef MSC_WriteWordFast(uint32_t *address,
00798                                   void const *data,
00799                                   uint32_t numBytes)
00800 {
00801   return MSC_WriteWordI(address, data, numBytes, mscWriteFast);
00802 }
00803 #if defined(__ICCARM__)
00804 #pragma diag_default=Ta022

00811 
00812 #if defined( _MSC_MASSLOCK_MASK )
00813 /***************************************************************************/
00822 #if !defined(EM_MSC_RUN_FROM_FLASH)
00823 #if defined(__CC_ARM)  /* MDK-ARM compiler */
00824 #pragma arm section code="ram_code"
00825 #endif /* __CC_ARM */
00826 #endif /* !EM_MSC_RUN_FROM_FLASH */
00827 MSC_Status_TypeDef MSC_MassErase(void)
00828 {
00829   /* Enable writing to the MSC */
00830   MSC->WRITECTRL |= MSC_WRITECTRL_WREN;
00831 
00832   /* Unlock device mass erase */
00833   MSC->MASSLOCK = MSC_MASSLOCK_LOCKKEY_UNLOCK;
00834 
00835   /* Erase first 512K block */
00836   MSC->WRITECMD = MSC_WRITECMD_ERASEMAIN0;
00837 
00838   /* Waiting for erase to complete */
00839   while ((MSC->STATUS & MSC_STATUS_BUSY));
00840 
00841 #if ((FLASH_SIZE >= (512 * 1024)) && defined( _MSC_WRITECMD_ERASEMAIN1_MASK ))
00842   /* Erase second 512K block */
00843   MSC->WRITECMD = MSC_WRITECMD_ERASEMAIN1;
00844 
00845   /* Waiting for erase to complete */
00846   while ((MSC->STATUS & MSC_STATUS_BUSY));
00847 #endif
00848 
00849   /* Restore mass erase lock */
00850   MSC->MASSLOCK = MSC_MASSLOCK_LOCKKEY_LOCK;
00851 
00852   /* This will only successfully return if calling function is also in SRAM */
00853   return mscReturnOk;
00854 }
00855 #if defined(__CC_ARM)  /* MDK-ARM compiler */
00856 #pragma arm section code
00857 #endif /* __CC_ARM */
00858 #endif
00859 
00862 #endif /* defined(MSC_COUNT) && (MSC_COUNT > 0) */
